did.physdesc: 7 sound tape reels (13 hr.) : analog, 3 3/4 ips, half track, mono ; 5 in.
did.abstract: Field recordings made on the Navajo Indian Reservation during July-September of 1969. Interviews with multiple Navajo speakers, consisting of elicitation of Navajo words and phrases, with commentary and questions.

odd.head: Sound quality note
odd.p: At the time the audio was migrated to DAT around 1991, the following was noted by the audio archivist: "Overall an extremely problem-plagued collection.... The overiding problem is frequent speed variation of the tapes, due to a fluctuation in voltage supplied to the collector's tape recorder from an electric generator. An attempt has been made during re-recording to RDAT to correct speed variation on the original tapes by use of the pitch control on the playback machine (OTARI MX-5050B11), which has a plus-minue factor of 7% in variable speed control." More specific sound quality issues are noted in the item record for each program.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related manuscript material by the collector can be found in the Phillips Fund Collection (Mss.497.3.Am4).
